bibl.title: J.W. Tripp v. Territory of Washington. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Jefferson County Third Judicial District Court

body.p: In the County Court of the COUNTY OF Jefferson State of Territory of Washington
In the matter of the application } Petition fot Writ of J.W. Tripp for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon. C.B. Darwin Judge of the County District Court of the 3rd judicial County of District of the Territory State of Washington

THE PETITION of J.W. Tripp respectfully shows: That he --- is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined, and restrained of his liberty by John H. Woodly, Sheriff of the County of Jefferson W.T. at the jail in the said County of Jefferson in the State of Territory.
That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal; and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to wit:
A commitment issued by the Justice of the Peace on a charge of murder, where of there is no probable cause, or evidence to justify said commitment

WHEREFORE, your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to the said John H. Woodly, Sheriff commanding him to have the body of J.W. Tripp before your Honor, at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor, concerning him together with the time and cause of his detention and said Writ; and that he may be restored to his liberty.
State of Territory of Washington } ss. County of Jefferson

J.W. Tripp being duly sworn, says, that he is the petitioned named in the foregoing petition; that he has read the said petition and knows the contents thereof, and that the same is true of his own knowledge except as to those matters that he believes to be true
Subscribed and sworn to before me, this 3rd day of June A.D. 1867
In the matter of the application of J.W. Tripp for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed June 4 1867 J Seavey Deputy Clerk.
